name: Vegan Chiles en Nogada
description: Vegan Chiles en Nogada, roasted poblano chile is stuffed with an aromatic picadillo, covered in walnut cream sauce and pomegranate seeds.

video.name: Vegan Chiles en Nogada
video.description: Vegan Chiles en Nogada, roasted poblano filled with stewed lentils and smothered in a creamy walnut sauce.

recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 cup Walnuts, (soaked in water the night before, drained)
1 1/2  cup Baguette or bolillo, (cut crust off, cut bread into cubes)
1 1/2  tsp. Sugar or sweetener of choice
1  Pomegranate, cut, peeled, and seeds removed

recipeInstructions.text: Fill a medium pot with water and add lentils, ½ of an onion, and 2 smashed garlic cloves. Bring to a simmer over medium heat and cook until tender, about 20 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Fill a medium pot with water and add lentils, ½ of an onion, and 2 smashed garlic cloves. Bring to a simmer over medium heat and cook until tender, about 20 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: While the lentils are cooking, place the two tomatoes and the poblano peppers on a sheet tray. Turn your oven broiler to high and place sheet tray on the top rack of the oven. Let them cook for a couple of minutes on each side until the tomato and the chiles begin to soften and have black spots all over. Remove from heat. Place the tomates and chiles in a bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Let rest 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: While the lentils are cooking, place the two tomatoes and the poblano peppers on a sheet tray. Turn your oven broiler to high and place sheet tray on the top rack of the oven. Let them cook for a couple of minutes on each side until the tomato and the chiles begin to soften and have black spots all over. Remove from heat. Place the tomates and chiles in a bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Let rest 5 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Drain the lentils, reserve 1 cup of the lentil cooking liquid, and using a potato masher, mash them to break them up.
recipeInstructions.name: Drain the lentils, reserve 1 cup of the lentil cooking liquid, and using a potato masher, mash them to break them up.

recipeInstructions.text: Peel the poblano peppers, make 1 cut lengthwise with a knife, and remove the seeds. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Peel the poblano peppers, make 1 cut lengthwise with a knife, and remove the seeds. Set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove half of the skin off of the tomatoes, and using a blender process them into a puree. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove half of the skin off of the tomatoes, and using a blender process them into a puree. Set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Set a large pot to medium heat, add ¼ cup of water, and add onion. Cook for 4-5 minutes until onion begins to soften and look translucent.
recipeInstructions.name: Set a large pot to medium heat, add ¼ cup of water, and add onion. Cook for 4-5 minutes until onion begins to soften and look translucent.

recipeInstructions.text: Add garlic and cook for 2 more minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Add garlic and cook for 2 more minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Add cooked lentils, mix well, and pour in tomato puree. Let cook for 3-4 minutes or until the puree begins to bubble and change to a darker red color.
recipeInstructions.name: Add cooked lentils, mix well, and pour in tomato puree. Let cook for 3-4 minutes or until the puree begins to bubble and change to a darker red color.

recipeInstructions.text: Add clove, cinnamon, black pepper, plantain, apple, pear, almonds, olives, capers, and raisins. Stir mixture.
recipeInstructions.name: Add clove, cinnamon, black pepper, plantain, apple, pear, almonds, olives, capers, and raisins. Stir mixture.

recipeInstructions.text: Add 1 cup of the liquid you reserved from the lentils, and simmer for 20 min or until the plantain is cooke through. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: Add 1 cup of the liquid you reserved from the lentils, and simmer for 20 min or until the plantain is cooke through. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

recipeInstructions.text: While the picadillo is cooking, soak the cut bread in the cup of almond milk for 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: While the picadillo is cooking, soak the cut bread in the cup of almond milk for 5 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: In a blender, place the soaked bread and milk, previously soaked and drained walnuts, sugar, and white wine, blend until smooth. Season to taste with salt. It should have the consistency of a cream sauce. If it is too thick, add more almond milk. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: In a blender, place the soaked bread and milk, previously soaked and drained walnuts, sugar, and white wine, blend until smooth. Season to taste with salt. It should have the consistency of a cream sauce. If it is too thick, add more almond milk. Set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Stuff the chiles rellenos with the lentil picadillo. Place the chiles seam side down on a plate. Pour walnut sauce over them, and sprinkle with pomegranate seeds and chopped parsley.
